head.title: COVID 19 - Gloucester City Public Schools

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

span.strong: Governor Phil Murphy issued an executive order on March 9, 2020 that all schools in the State of New Jersey are closed. Governor Murphy has extended the closure until May 15, 2020.

span.br: The following page has been set up to house information about Gloucester City School Districts response to this Coronavirus emerging situation. Since the circumstances around the spread of Coronavirus are ever-changing, we will continue to update this page with any new resources that we might be able to provide.

p.span: Any urgent information or significant developments surrounding this issue will continue to be communicated here, through email, and texts.

span.style: font-size: medium; text-decoration: underline; font-family: Tahoma;
font-size: medium; text-decoration: underline; font-family: Tahoma;

span.br:
Q. Do the virtual learning days count towards regular school days?
A. Yes
Q. Is the senior trip being rescheduled?
A. Yes, June 6th through June 10th. We are making every attempt to keep the tradition of the Senior Trip alive and well for our seniors. Please see the attached details your response is needed by April 20, 2020.
Remote Instruction:
ECC & CSS Student Learning Packets can be found here.
Lions Family Resources:
Parent Guidelines
Mental and Emotional Resources
NJ Help Hotlines
Family Essential Assistance
Health Resources
Breakfast and Lunch:
We will hold a Monday Only breakfast and lunch distribution from 11AM-12PM.
Five days worth of meals will be handed out per student.
REMEMBER your students ID card or number.
Pop your trunk or lower your back window for the food exchange and everyones safety.
Click here for details: Middle School - Breakfast & Lunch
Crescent Trailer Park - will have "Grab & Go" lunch and snacks in the front office.
Athletic Updates:

br.br:
Questions and Answers 3/18/20
Statewide Testing has been cancelled. This will not impact graduation requirements.
Technology Help:
Computer technician assistance will continue 5 days a week, even during spring break, GMS rear entrance, do not go up on the loading dock, remain on lower level for everyone's safety. Please email technology first, technologyhelp@gcsd.k12.nj.us, so they can troubleshoot remotely, then if that doesn’t work please go to the Middle School during the hours below.

span.span:
Mondays 12:00 pm to 1:00 pm
Tuesdays through Thursdays 3:00 pm to 4:00 pm
Fridays 11:00 am to 12 pm
